radiographic_examinations.findings: The liver is normal in echogenicity. There is no intrahepatic biliary duct dilatation. The portal vein is patent with hepatopetal flow. The gallbladder is normal; however, there are gallstones in the gallbladder. The common bile duct measures 5 mm. There are 2 small cysts in the left lobe of the liver measuring 9 and 8 mm. The visualized portions of the right kidney are unremarkable. The spleen measures 12 cm and is homogeneous. The pancreas appears unremarkable. No peripancreatic fluid collections are seen.
